# Getting Started

In this exercise, infer, ggstatsplot and tidyverse will be used.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
packages = c('ggstatsplot', 'ggside', 
             'tidyverse', 'ggdist')
for (p in packages){
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)){
    install.packages(p)
  }
}
```

# Data Import

In this exercise, the Exam.csv data will be used.

```{r}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
```{r}
set.seed(1234)
gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "b", #p,np,r,b 
  test.value = 60,
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```
```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "p",
  messages = FALSE
)
```
```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = RACE, 
  y = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, 
  pairwise.display = "s",
  p.adjust.method = "fdr",
  messages = FALSE
)
```
```{r}
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam,
  x = MATHS,
  y = ENGLISH,
  marginal = FALSE,
)
```
```{r}
exam1 <- exam %>% 
  mutate(MATHS_bins = 
           cut(MATHS, 
               breaks = c(0,60,75,85,100))
)

ggbarstats(exam1, 
           x = MATHS_bins, 
           y = GENDER)
```

# Installing and loading the required libraries


```{r}
packages = c('readxl', 'report', 'performance', 
             'parameters', 'see')
for(p in packages){
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)){
    install.packages(p)
  }
  library(p, character.only = T)
}
```
# Importing Excel file: readxl methods

```{r}
car_resale <- read_xls("data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", 
                       "data")
```

# Multiple Regression Model using lm()

```{r}
model <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + 
              Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale)
model
```
# Model Diagnostic: checking for multicolinearity:

```{r}
check_collinearity(model)
```

```{r}
check_c <- check_collinearity(model)
plot(check_c)
```
